text.#text: The

One or more appellants may bring an action under this chapter as the representative party of a
			 class on behalf of all members of the class only if the following criteria
			 are met:
There is at least one question of law or fact common to the class.
The class is likely to consist of at least 50 members.

The resolution of the common questions of law or fact is likely to have a material effect on the
			 claims of the members of the class (including with respect to the process
			 by which such claims are adjudicated).
The representative party will fairly and adequately protect the interests of the class.
